channel.title: Julia on Ingots of learning
channel.description: Recent content in Julia on Ingots of learning

item.title: A simple speed comparison between MATLAB and Julia
item.description: In an effort to populate my blog with content, I am on a bit of a content-making spree, so I apologise in advance if things are a bit odd. Julia is a language that seems to be, in my opinion, a good point to move on from MATLAB. It promises C++ speed, with the high-level coding practices of MATLAB. If you wrap your script in a function, you get your speedup.

item.title: Learning fluid simulation!
item.description: One of the things I have been working towards over the past couple of months is creating a fluid simulation program in Julia. While packages such as Lily-Pad, WaterLily, and FluidFlowSimulation.jl already exist, I want to actually learn how to do finite element numerical simulation! Why do I want to do this? Well, I would like to become a game developer. Specifically, I want to work on some sort of physics system within a game.
